summary: 1 MEDIUM YAGNI concern, 1 LOW premature optimization

issues.title: quality_details JSONB field may be premature
issues.why: Storing detailed quality breakdown in JSONB (vocabulary_match, confidence_score, etc) but no code reads it. YAGNI violation - adding complexity for potential future use. Storage + write overhead + schema complexity with zero current benefit.
issues.fix: Remove quality_details column for now. Keep quality_score (0.0-1.0) which is sufficient. Add breakdown column in future migration if concrete use case emerges (analytics dashboard, re-scoring, etc).
issues.verify: Confirm: Do you have immediate use case for quality_details? If not, remove.

issues.title: Index on quality_score without queries
issues.why: Migration adds idx_themes_quality_score but no queries filter by quality_score. Index with no queries = wasted storage + maintenance overhead. Premature optimization.
issues.fix: Remove index for now. Add it when you write a query that needs it (quality dashboard, analytics). Follow rule: index when you have slow query, not 'might need later'.
